title: Why Amazon's founder Jeff Bezos is very optimistic about Trump 2.0?
content: Jeff Bezos expressed optimism about the Trump administration, citing potential deregulation benefits. He defended his decision against The Washington Post endorsing candidates and aimed to dispel Trump's perceived media hostility. Bezos also downplayed concerns about Elon Musk's influence on regulatory reforms impacting their space ventures.
summary: Jeff Bezos expressed optimism about the Trump administration, citing potential deregulation benefits.  He defended his decision against The Washington Post endorsing candidates and aimed to dispel Trump's perceived media hostility. Bezos also downplayed concerns about Elon Musk's influence on regulatory reforms impacting their space ventures.

title: 'Tens of thousands of hours of footage': How cops plan to hunt down Brian Thompson's killer
content: In a brazen Manhattan shooting, UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed Wednesday morning. The NYPD is leveraging its extensive surveillance network, including footage from public and private cameras, to track the skilled gunman who fled into Central Park. Despite capturing the suspect's movements, his identity and motive remain unknown, highlighting the challenges of even the most sophisticated surveillance systems.
summary: In a brazen Manhattan shooting, UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was killed Wednesday morning.  The NYPD is leveraging its extensive surveillance network, including footage from public and private cameras, to track the skilled gunman who fled into Central Park. Despite capturing the suspect's movements, his identity and motive remain unknown, highlighting the challenges of even the most sophisticated surveillance systems.

title: Detectives uncover new evidences in Brian Thompson's murder case
content: A masked gunman shot and killed UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan. Shell casings inscribed with "deny," "defend," and "depose" were found at the scene. The assailant fled on an e-bike into Central Park, and police are searching for a potential witness seen fleeing the scene.
summary: A masked gunman shot and killed UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan.  Shell casings inscribed with "deny," "defend," and "depose" were found at the scene. The assailant fled on an e-bike into Central Park, and police are searching for a potential witness seen fleeing the scene.

title: Isro begins revised countdown for Proba-3 mission launch
content: Isro launched ESA's Proba-3 mission on December 5th, after a delay due to a propulsion system anomaly. The two satellites will study the Sun's corona by flying in precise formation, a key demonstration for future missions. This marks ESA's return to launching with Isro after 23 years and follows Isro's recent Aditya-L1 solar mission.
summary: Isro launched ESA's Proba-3 mission on December 5th, after a delay due to a propulsion system anomaly.  The two satellites will study the Sun's corona by flying in precise formation, a key demonstration for future missions. This marks ESA's return to launching with Isro after 23 years and follows Isro's recent Aditya-L1 solar mission.

title: Ex-defence chief suggested martial law to President Yoon, says South Korean interior minister
content: South Korean Defense Minister Kim Yong-hyun resigned after allegedly suggesting martial law to President Yoon Suk Yeol. President Yoon declared martial law, citing North Korean threats, and deployed troops to parliament. An impeachment motion against Yoon is scheduled for a parliamentary vote on Saturday. Choi Byung-huk has been selected as the new defense minister.
summary: South Korean Defense Minister Kim Yong-hyun resigned after allegedly suggesting martial law to President Yoon Suk Yeol.  President Yoon declared martial law, citing North Korean threats, and deployed troops to parliament.  An impeachment motion against Yoon is scheduled for a parliamentary vote on Saturday.  Choi Byung-huk has been selected as the new defense minister.

title: Nearly 12 Vietnamese soldiers killed during military exercise
content: Tragedy struck a Vietnamese military training exercise in Dong Nai province when an accidental explosion claimed the lives of twelve soldiers. The incident occurred Monday night during a severe storm, reportedly when a lightning strike triggered an electronic detonator while the soldiers were transporting explosives. Recovery efforts are underway, and the Ministry of Defence has launched an urgent investigation.
summary: Tragedy struck a Vietnamese military training exercise in Dong Nai province when an accidental explosion claimed the lives of twelve soldiers. The incident occurred Monday night during a severe storm, reportedly when a lightning strike triggered an electronic detonator while the soldiers were transporting explosives. Recovery efforts are underway, and the Ministry of Defence has launched an urgent investigation.

title: Are Prince Harry and Meghan Markle planning to stay in US forever? Here is the answer
content: Prince Harry expressed contentment with his US life, emphasizing the freedom to engage in activities with his children that wouldn't be possible in the UK. While Harry spoke at a New York summit, Meghan sent holiday greetings from a London charity event. The couple's separate appearances fuel ongoing divorce rumors.
summary: Prince Harry expressed contentment with his US life, emphasizing the freedom to engage in activities with his children that wouldn't be possible in the UK. While Harry spoke at a New York summit, Meghan sent holiday greetings from a London charity event. The couple's separate appearances fuel ongoing divorce rumors.

title: Southern China construction site collapse: Search underway for 13 missing workers
French twist: Macron’s premier ousted in no-trust vote. What's next
content: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier's government was ousted after a no-confidence vote spurred by a budget dispute. The far-right and left joined forces to oppose Barnier's proposed budget cuts and tax increases. President Macron now faces the challenge of appointing a new prime minister who can navigate a deeply divided parliament and address France's economic woes.
summary: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier's government was ousted after a no-confidence vote spurred by a budget dispute.  The far-right and left joined forces to oppose Barnier's proposed budget cuts and tax increases. President Macron now faces the challenge of appointing a new prime minister who can navigate a deeply divided parliament and address France's economic woes.

title: US President-elect Donald Trump nominates former congressman Billy Long as IRS commissioner
content: Former Missouri Congressman Billy Long has been nominated by President-elect Trump to lead the IRS, replacing current commissioner Daniel Werfel. This move comes amidst Republican opposition to the Biden administration's IRS funding increases. Long, known for his auctioneering background, will require Senate confirmation for the position.
summary: Former Missouri Congressman Billy Long has been nominated by President-elect Trump to lead the IRS, replacing current commissioner Daniel Werfel.  This move comes amidst Republican opposition to the Biden administration's IRS funding increases. Long, known for his auctioneering background, will require Senate confirmation for the position.

title: Manhunt underway for killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson after fatal shooting
content: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, 50, was shot and killed outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan. A masked gunman fired repeatedly after an apparent gun malfunction, then fled on a Citi Bike. Police are investigating the incident, analyzing surveillance footage, and exploring potential motives, including workplace connections.
summary: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, 50, was shot and killed outside a Hilton hotel in Manhattan.  A masked gunman fired repeatedly after an apparent gun malfunction, then fled on a Citi Bike. Police are investigating the incident, analyzing surveillance footage, and exploring potential motives, including workplace connections.

title: Biden administration weighs preemptive pardons for Fauci, Schiff, and other ahead of Trump return
content: White House officials are debating preemptive pardons for individuals like Dr. Anthony Fauci, Adam Schiff, and Liz Cheney, anticipating potential prosecution under a returning Trump administration. This follows Trump's selection of Kash Patel as FBI lead and concerns about retribution against perceived critics. The discussions consider the implications of such pardons and the financial burdens of potential legal defenses.
summary: White House officials are debating preemptive pardons for individuals like Dr. Anthony Fauci, Adam Schiff, and Liz Cheney, anticipating potential prosecution under a returning Trump administration.  This follows Trump's selection of Kash Patel as FBI lead and concerns about retribution against perceived critics.  The discussions consider the implications of such pardons and the financial burdens of potential legal defenses.

title: California school shooting: Two children hospitalised, suspected gunman dead
content: Two children were shot at Feather River School of Seventh-Day Adventists in Oroville, California, after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The shooter later died by suicide. The injured students were transported to hospitals, and their conditions remain unknown. Authorities believe the shooter had no connection to the school. Students were reunited with their families at a nearby church.
summary: Two children were shot at Feather River School of Seventh-Day Adventists in Oroville, California, after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The shooter later died by suicide.  The injured students were transported to hospitals, and their conditions remain unknown.  Authorities believe the shooter had no connection to the school. Students were reunited with their families at a nearby church.

title: Hamas threatens to 'neutralise' hostages if Israel launches rescue op
content: Hamas warned it would "neutralize" hostages if Israel attempts another rescue operation like the one in June at Gaza's Nuseirat camp. An internal Hamas statement revealed the group instructed operatives to enforce stricter conditions for captives and prepare for immediate action if Israel intervenes.
summary: Hamas warned it would "neutralize" hostages if Israel attempts another rescue operation like the one in June at Gaza's Nuseirat camp. An internal Hamas statement revealed the group instructed operatives to enforce stricter conditions for captives and prepare for immediate action if Israel intervenes.

title: Iran Nobel peace winner released from prison for med treatment
UK MP tables bill in House classing Sikhs and Jews as ethnic groups
content: Labour MP Preet Kaur Gill introduced a bill in the UK House of Commons to classify Sikhs and Jews as ethnic groups for public service data collection. Gill highlighted the inadequacy of existing religious data and cited disproportionate impacts on these communities during the pandemic and in areas like homelessness and addiction.
summary: Labour MP Preet Kaur Gill introduced a bill in the UK House of Commons to classify Sikhs and Jews as ethnic groups for public service data collection. Gill highlighted the inadequacy of existing religious data and cited disproportionate impacts on these communities during the pandemic and in areas like homelessness and addiction.

title: Meghan Markle accused of distancing from community by neighbours
content: Meghan Markle faces criticism from a Montecito neighbor for lack of community engagement, while Prince Harry receives mixed reviews for his local appearances and public work. The Sussexes' public image continues to be scrutinized, with accusations of orchestrated campaigns and complaints about Harry's memoir. Despite the negativity, Meghan expresses contentment with her family life.
summary: Meghan Markle faces criticism from a Montecito neighbor for lack of community engagement, while Prince Harry receives mixed reviews for his local appearances and public work.  The Sussexes' public image continues to be scrutinized, with accusations of orchestrated campaigns and complaints about Harry's memoir.  Despite the negativity, Meghan expresses contentment with her family life.

title: Pete Hegseth's mother defends him after accusing him of mistreating women
content: Pete Hegseth's mother defended him on Fox News against past accusations of mistreating women, claiming her previous email was written in haste. His nomination for defense secretary faces scrutiny over alleged sexual misconduct, financial mismanagement, and drinking habits. Despite the mounting allegations and potential replacement by Ron DeSantis, Hegseth continues to seek support from Republican senators.
summary: Pete Hegseth's mother defended him on Fox News against past accusations of mistreating women, claiming her previous email was written in haste.  His nomination for defense secretary faces scrutiny over alleged sexual misconduct, financial mismanagement, and drinking habits.  Despite the mounting allegations and potential replacement by Ron DeSantis, Hegseth continues to seek support from Republican senators.

title: ‘Not once did I suspect…’: Nicole Saphier defends Pete Hegseth
content: Fox News contributor Dr Nicole Saphier and other colleagues have defended Pete Hegseth against NBC News allegations of on-air intoxication. They deny witnessing any unprofessional behavior, while Hegseth's nomination for Secretary of Defense faces scrutiny amid these claims and reports of Trump considering Ron DeSantis for the position.
summary: Fox News contributor Dr Nicole Saphier and other colleagues have defended Pete Hegseth against NBC News allegations of on-air intoxication.  They deny witnessing any unprofessional behavior, while Hegseth's nomination for Secretary of Defense faces scrutiny amid these claims and reports of Trump considering Ron DeSantis for the position.

title: Power grid collapse plunges Cuba into darkness
content: Cuba plunged into darkness early Wednesday due to a failure at its largest power plant, Antonio Guiteras, marking the third major blackout in two months. The nationwide outage, attributed to aging infrastructure, follows recent hurricanes and dwindling fuel imports, exacerbating the island's economic crisis and sparking public frustration.
summary: Cuba plunged into darkness early Wednesday due to a failure at its largest power plant, Antonio Guiteras, marking the third major blackout in two months.  The nationwide outage, attributed to aging infrastructure, follows recent hurricanes and dwindling fuel imports, exacerbating the island's economic crisis and sparking public frustration.
